FuncDef:
The access-limit command sets the maximum number of access users.
The undo access-limit command restores the default setting.
By default, the maximum number of access users is not limited for a domain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of users allowed to access the system, which is the sum of the maximum number of management users and the maximum number of common users.
Access users are classified into the following types based on the access mode:
Administrative users: access the system using Telnet, FTP, terminal, or SSH.Common users.
For the NE40E-X3:The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 246272.
For the NE40E-X8 and NE40E-X16:The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1078272.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To facilitate the user access management, run the access-limit command to set the maximum number of users that are allowed to access the system.
Configuration Impact
After the access-limit command is used, when the number of users accessing the system exceeds the limit, the system denies any new access request and prompts user authentication failures.
Precautions
The access-limit command is used to restrict the number of users that are allowed to access the system in a domain, regardless of the access user type.
